comments.html: >> There were rumors Cisco had it in its early years [...] Kirk Lougheed has incidentally confirmed that parser police actually existed, see the recording of IBOENT-2004 at CLUS 2022, starting at approx. 24:30...
comments.name: Christoph

comments.html: Russ White also talked about it recently on an episode of the hedge.
comments.name: Brian

comments.html:
Cumulus NVUE takes this to the next level: The initial VRRPv3 configuration - with the link local address first - works. But then when it saves the config, it sorts the addresses in alphabetical order 🤦

Guess where "FE80:" addresses end up...
comments.name: Jeroen van Bemmel
